member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverGroups.CustomizableSolverGroup
member.summary:
Constraint made from other constraints. Putting constraints into a solver group can help with organization and, in some cases, performance.
If you have multiple constraints between the same two entities, putting the constraints into a CustomizableSolverGroup can lower lock contention.
Be careful about overloading a single solvergroup; it should be kept relatively small to ensure that the multithreading loads stay balanced.

member.summary: Removes a solver updateable from the solver group.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionDetectionSettings
member.summary: Settings class containing global information about collision detection.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionDetectionSettings.ContactInvalidationLengthSquared
member.summary:
For persistent manifolds, contacts are represented by an offset in local space of two colliding bodies. The distance between these offsets transformed into world space and projected onto a plane defined by the contact normal squared is compared against this value. If this value is exceeded, the contact is removed from the contact manifold.
If the world is smaller or larger than 'normal' for the engine, adjusting this value proportionally can improve contact caching behavior. The default value of .01f works well for worlds that operate on the order of 1 unit.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionDetectionSettings.ContactMinimumSeparationDistanceSquared
member.summary: In persistent manifolds, if two contacts are too close together, then the system will not use one of them. This avoids redundant constraints. Defaults to .01f.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionDetectionSettings.AllowedPenetration
member.summary: The default amount of allowed penetration into the margin before position correcting impulses will be applied. Defaults to .01f.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionDetectionSettings.DefaultMargin
member.summary: Default collision margin around objects. Margins help prevent objects from interpenetrating and improve stability. Defaults to .04f.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionDetectionSettings.NonconvexNormalAngleDifferenceMinimum
member.summary: In regular convex manifolds, two contacts are considered redundant if their positions are too close together. In nonconvex manifolds, the normal must also be tested, since a contact in the same location could have a different normal. This property is the minimum angle in radians between normals below which contacts are considered redundant.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionDetectionSettings.MaximumContactDistance
member.summary: Maximum distance between the surfaces defining a contact point allowed before removing the contact. Defaults to .1f.

member.summary: Location of the ray hit.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.RayHit.Normal
member.summary: Normal of the ray hit.

member.summary: T parameter of the ray hit. The ray hit location is equal to the ray origin added to the ray direction multiplied by T.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Settings.MotionSettings
member.summary: Contains global settings about motion updating.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.MotionSettings.UseRk4AngularIntegration
member.summary: Whether or not to use RK4 angular integration. This can improve simulation quality sometimes, but not always. It has a slight performance impact. Enabling this when ConserveAngularMomentum is set to true may be helpful. Defaults to false.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.MotionSettings.ConserveAngularMomentum
member.summary: Whether or not to conserve angular momentum. This produces slightly more realistic angular behavior, but can reduce stability. Consider using a smaller timestep, enabling RK4 angular integration, or both. Do not use singular inertia tensors while momentum conservation is enabled. Defaults to false.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.MotionSettings.DefaultPositionUpdateMode
member.summary: The default position updating mode used by position updateables. Defaults to Discrete.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.MotionSettings.UseExtraExpansionForContinuousBoundingBoxes
member.summary: It is possible for an object in danger of being hit by a moving object to have a bounding box which does not contain the resulting motion, and CCD will fail to detect a secondary collision. Setting this to true will take into account nearby objects' velocities and use them to enlarge the bounding box so that secondary collisions are not missed. The larger size of bounding boxes can cause an increase in collision pairs during stressful situations, which can harm performance. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Settings.MotionSettings.CoreShapeScaling
member.summary: The scaling to apply to the core shapes used for continuous collision detection tests. Values should be between 0 and 0.99f. The smaller the value, the smaller the shapes used to perform CCD are, and more collisions are missed. Defaults to .8f.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionResponseSettings
member.summary: Contains global settings relating to the collision response system.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionResponseSettings.BouncinessVelocityThreshold
member.summary: Impact velocity above which the bouciness of the object pair is taken into account. Below the threshold, no extra energy is added. Defaults to 1.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionResponseSettings.MaximumPositionCorrectionSpeed
member.summary: Maximum speed at which interpenetrating objects or out of alignment joints will attempt to correct. Only applies when the Baumgarte method is used when useSplitImpulsePositionCorrection is set to false for contacts. Defaults to 2.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionResponseSettings.PenetrationRecoveryStiffness
member.summary: Fraction of position error to convert into corrective momentum when using the Baumgarte position correction method, active when useSplitImpulsePositionCorrection is set to false. Defaults to .2.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionResponseSettings.StaticFrictionVelocityThreshold
member.summary: Magnitude of relative velocity at a contact point below which staticFriction is used. dynamicFriction is used when velocity exceeds this threshold. Defaults to .2.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionResponseSettings.TwistFrictionFactor
member.summary: Value by which a collision pair's friction coefficient will be multiplied to get the twist friction coefficient. Defaults to 1.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Entities.Prefabs.CompoundBody
member.summary: Acts as a grouping of multiple other objects. Can be used to form physically simulated concave shapes.

member.exception: Thrown when the bodies list is empty or there is a mix of kinematic and dynamic entities in the body list.

member.summary: Creates a new dynamic CompoundBody with the given subbodies.

member.summary: Collidable mesh which can be created from a reusable InstancedMeshShape. Very little data is needed for each individual InstancedMesh object, allowing a complicated mesh to be repeated many times. Since the hierarchy used to accelerate collisions is purely local, it may be marginally slower than an individual StaticMesh.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.MobileMeshShape.solidSidedness
member.summary: Sidedness required if the mesh is in solid mode. If the windings were reversed or double sided, the solidity would fight against shell contacts, leading to very bad jittering.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.MobileMeshShape.DepthDoubleCheckLimit
member.summary: If an object is detected to be within the mobile mesh with a penetration depth greater than this limit, it will try a different direction to verify that it wasn't a false positive.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.MobileMeshShape.MeshHitUniquenessThreshold
member.summary: The difference in t parameters in a ray cast under which two hits are considered to be redundant.

member.summary: Tests to see if a ray's origin is contained within the mesh. If it is, the hit location is found. If it isn't, the hit location is still valid if a hit occurred. If the origin isn't inside and there was no hit, the hit has a T value of float.MaxValue.
member.param: Ray in the local space of the shape to test.
The first hit against the mesh, if any.
member.returns: Whether or not the ray origin was in the mesh.

member.summary: Gets the bounding box of the mesh transformed first into world space, and then into the local space of another affine transform.
member.param: Transform to use to put the shape into world space.

member.summary: Gets the bounding box of the mesh transformed first into world space, and then into the local space of another affine transform.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.MobileMeshShape.MeshCollisionMargin
member.summary: Gets or sets the margin of the mobile mesh to use when colliding with other meshes. When colliding with non-mesh shapes, the mobile mesh has no margin.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.MobileMeshShape.TriangleMesh
member.summary: Gets or sets the TriangleMesh data structure used by this shape.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.MobileMeshShape.Transform
member.summary: Gets the transform used by the local mesh shape.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.MobileMeshShape.Solidity
member.summary: Gets the solidity of the mesh.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.MobileMeshShape.Sidedness
member.summary: Gets or sets the sidedness of the shape. This is a convenience property based on the Solidity property. If the shape is solid, this returns whatever sidedness is computed to make the triangles of the shape face outward. If the shape is solid, setting this property will change the sidedness that is used while the shape is solid.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.MobileMeshShape.NumberOfContainmentChecks
member.summary: This is how many tests are required before an object is accepted as actually inside the solid portion of a mesh. The reason for the additional tests is robustness; one test may fail, but two is extremely unlikely, and three more so. More tests may also introduce false negatives, though they resolve quickly and are generally not as much of a problem as false positives. Valid values are 1, 2, or 3. Defaults to 3.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.MobileMeshSolidity
member.summary: Solidity of a triangle or mesh. A triangle can be double sided, or allow one of its sides to let interacting objects through. The entire mesh can be made solid, which means objects on the interior still generate contacts even if there aren't any triangles to hit. Solidity requires the mesh to be closed.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.MobileMeshSolidity.DoubleSided
member.summary: The mesh will interact with objects coming from both directions.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.MobileMeshSolidity.Clockwise
member.summary: The mesh will interact with objects from which the winding of the triangles appears to be clockwise.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.MobileMeshSolidity.Counterclockwise
member.summary: The mesh will interact with objects from which the winding of the triangles appears to be counterclockwise.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.MobileMeshSolidity.Solid
member.summary: The mesh will treat objects inside of its concave shell as if the mesh had volume. Mesh must be closed for this to work properly.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Threading.ThreadTaskManager.ForLoop(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Action{System.Int32})
member.summary: Loops from the starting index (inclusive) to the ending index (exclusive), calling the loopBody at each iteration. The forLoop function will not return until all iterations are complete. This is meant to be used in a 'fork-join' model; only a single thread should be running a forLoop at any time.
member.param: Function that handles an individual iteration of the loop.

member.summary: Releases resources used by the object.

member.summary: Enqueues a task. This method also does not perform any locking; it should only be called when all worker threads of the thread pool are idle and all calls to this method are from the same thread.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.CollisionTests.CollisionAlgorithms.MPRToolbox.SurfaceEpsilon
member.summary: Gets or sets how close surface-finding based MPR methods have to get before exiting. Defaults to 1e-7.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.CollisionTests.CollisionAlgorithms.MPRToolbox.DepthRefinementEpsilon
member.summary: Gets or sets how close the penetration depth refinement system should converge before quitting. Making this smaller can help more precisely find a local minimum at the cost of performance. The change will likely only be visible on curved shapes, since polytopes will converge extremely rapidly to a precise local minimum. Defaults to 1e-4.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.CollisionTests.CollisionAlgorithms.MPRToolbox.RayCastSurfaceEpsilon
member.summary: Gets or sets how close surface-finding ray casts have to get before exiting. Defaults to 1e-9.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.CollisionTests.CollisionAlgorithms.MPRToolbox.MaximumDepthRefinementIterations
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of iterations to use to reach the local penetration depth minimum when using the RefinePenetration function. Increasing this allows the system to work longer to find local penetration minima. The change will likely only be visible on curved shapes, since polytopes will converge extremely rapidly to a precise local minimum. Defaults to 3.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Collidables.MobileCollidables.MobileMeshCollidable.ImproveBoundaryBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not the collision system should attempt to improve contact behavior at the boundaries between triangles. This has a slight performance cost, but prevents objects sliding across a triangle boundary from 'bumping,' and otherwise improves the robustness of contacts at edges and vertices.

This constructor sets the constraint's IsActive property to false by default.

member.summary: Constrains the relative orientation of two entities to within an ellipse.

member.summary: Constructs a new swing limit. This constructor sets the constraint's IsActive property to false by default.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.EllipseSwingLimit.#ctor(BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity,BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Constructs a new swing limit.
member.param: First entity connected by the constraint.
Second entity connected by the constraint.

Axis in world space to use as the initial unrestricted twist direction. This direction will be transformed to entity A's local space to form the basis's primary axis and to entity B's local space to form its twist axis. The basis's x and y axis are automatically created from the twist axis.
Maximum angle of rotation around the basis X axis.
Maximum angle of rotation around the basis Y axis.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.EllipseSwingLimit.#ctor(BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity,BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity)
member.summary: Constructs a new swing limit. Using this constructor will leave the limit uninitialized. Before using the limit in a simulation, be sure to set the basis axes using limit.basis.setLocalAxes or limit.basis.setWorldAxes and b's twist axis using the localTwistAxisB or twistAxisB properties.
member.param: First entity connected by the constraint.
Second entity connected by the constraint.

member.summary: Gets the basis attached to entity A. The primary axis is the "twist" axis attached to entity A. The xAxis is the axis around which the angle will be limited by maximumAngleX. Similarly, the yAxis is the axis around which the angle will be limited by maximumAngleY.

member.summary: Gets or sets the twist axis attached to entity B in world space. The transformed twist axis will be used to determine the angles around entity A's basis axes.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseSystems.SortAndSweep.Grid2DSortAndSweep
member.summary: Broad phase implementation that partitions objects into a 2d grid, and then performs a sort and sweep on the final axis.
member.remarks: This broad phase typically has very good collision performance and scales well with multithreading, but its query times can sometimes be worse than tree-based systems since it must scan cells. Keeping rays as short as possible helps avoid unnecessary cell checks. The performance can degrade noticeably in some situations involving significant off-axis motion.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseSystems.SortAndSweep.Grid2DSortAndSweep.#ctor(BEPUphysics.Threading.IThreadManager)
member.summary: Constructs a grid-based sort and sweep broad phase.
member.param: Thread manager to use for the broad phase.

member.summary: Constructs a grid-based sort and sweep broad phase.

member.summary: Adds an entry to the broad phase.

member.summary: Removes an entry from the broad phase.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseSystems.SortAndSweep.Grid2DSortAndSweep.CellSize

member.summary: Constructs a new suspension for a wheel.
member.param: Strength of the spring. Higher values resist compression more.
Damping constant of the spring. Higher values remove more momentum.
Direction of the suspension in the vehicle's local space. For a normal, straight down suspension, this would be (0, -1, 0).
Length of the suspension when uncompressed.
Place where the suspension hooks up to the body of the vehicle.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.TimeStepSettings.AccumulatedTime

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverSettings
member.summary: Contains information about how a wheel solves its constraints.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverSettings.currentIterations
member.summary: Used to count how many iterations have taken place so far.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverSettings.DefaultMinimumImpulse
member.summary: The value to assign to new constraints' SolverSettings.MinimumImpulse. Impulses with magnitudes below this value will count as effectively zero in determining iteration early outs unless changed in the constraint's solver settings. High values quicken the short circuit but can cause instability, while low values will often prevent short circuiting, possibly increasing accuracy but harming performance. Defaults to .001f.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverSettings.DefaultMinimumIterations
member.summary: The value to assign to new constraints' SolverSettings.MinimumIterations. Constraints are able to skip extra calculations if deemed appropriate after they complete the minimum iterations. Higher values force the system to wait longer before trying to early out, possibly improving behavior. Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverSettings.MaximumIterations
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum iterations that the wheel constraint can undergo. If the space's iteration count is lower than this, the solver will only attempt as many iterations as the space iteration count. Lower iteration counts are less accurate, but can improve performance.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverSettings.MinimumIterations
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum number of iterations that will be applied. If an impulse of magnitude smaller than the MinimumImpulse is applied, a 'tiny impulses' counter increases. Once it exceeds the MinimumIterations, the system can decide to stop solving to save time if appropriate.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverSettings.MinimumImpulse
member.summary: Gets or sets the lower limit for impulses. Impulses applied with magnitudes less than this will increment the 'tiny impulse' counter, which is checked against the MinimumIterations property. If there's been too many tiny impulses in a row, then the system will stop trying to solve to save time. Higher values will allow the system to give up earlier, but can harm accuracy.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SingleEntity.SingleEntityAngularMotor
member.summary: Constraint which attempts to restrict the relative angular velocity of two entities to some value. Can use a target relative orientation to apply additional force.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SingleEntity.SingleEntityAngularMotor.#ctor(BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity)
member.summary: Constructs a new constraint which attempts to restrict the relative angular velocity of two entities to some value.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SingleEntity.SingleEntityAngularMotor.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new constraint which attempts to restrict the relative angular velocity of two entities to some value. This constructor will make the angular motor start with isActive set to false.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SingleEntity.SingleEntityAngularMotor.SolveIteration

member.summary: Computes the maxForceDt and maxForceDtSquared fields.

member.summary: Gets the motor's velocity and servo settings.

member.summary: Gets the total impulse applied by this constraint.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SingleEntity.SingleEntityAngularMotor.Error

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseSystems.SortAndSweep.SortAndSweep1D
member.summary: Simple and standard implementation of the one-axis sort and sweep (sweep and prune) algorithm.
member.remarks: In small scenarios, it can be the quickest option. It uses very little memory. However, it tends to scale poorly relative to other options and can slow down significantly when entries cluster along the axis. Additionally, it supports no queries at all.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Threading.SpecializedThreadManager
member.summary: Manages the engine's threads.
member.remarks: Separates the management of ThreadTasks and loops into specialized systems. Should have generally higher performance than the SimpleThreadManager.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Threading.SpecializedThreadManager.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new specialized thread manager that manages loops and tasks separately.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Threading.SpecializedThreadManager.Finalize
member.summary: Releases resources used by the object.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Threading.SpecializedThreadManager.AddThread
member.summary: Adds a new worker thread to the engine.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Threading.SpecializedThreadManager.AddThread(System.Action{System.Object},System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a new worker thread to the engine.
member.param: Function that the new thread will call before entering its work loop.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Threading.SpecializedThreadManager.RemoveThread
member.summary: Removes a worker thread from the engine.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Threading.SpecializedThreadManager.EnqueueTask(System.Action{System.Object},System.Object)
member.summary: Enqueues a task to the thread manager. This should be safe to call from multiple threads and from other tasks.
member.param: Data to give to the task.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Threading.SpecializedThreadManager.ForLoop(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Action{System.Int32})
member.summary: Loops from the starting index (inclusive) to the ending index (exclusive), calling the loopBody at each iteration. The forLoop function will not return until all iterations are complete. This is meant to be used in a 'fork-join' model; only a single thread should be running a forLoop at any time.
member.param: Function that handles an individual iteration of the loop.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Threading.SpecializedThreadManager.WaitForTaskCompletion
member.summary: Waits until all tasks enqueued using enqueueTask are complete.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Threading.SpecializedThreadManager.Dispose
member.summary: Releases resources used by the object.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Threading.SpecializedThreadManager.LoopManager
member.summary: Gets or sets the loop manager used by this threading system. The loop manager is used to specifically parallelize forloops.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Threading.SpecializedThreadManager.TaskManager
member.summary: Gets or sets the task manager used by this threading system. The task manager is used for anything that isn't strictly a for loop.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Threading.SpecializedThreadManager.ThreadCount
member.summary: Gets the number of threads in use by the manager.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Paths.CurveEndpointBehavior
member.summary: Defines how a curve behaves beyond an endpoint.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Paths.CurveEndpointBehavior.Wrap
member.summary: When the time exceeds the endpoint, it wraps around to the other end of the curve.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Paths.CurveEndpointBehavior.Clamp
member.summary: Times exceeding the endpoint are clamped to the endpoint's value.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Paths.CurveEndpointBehavior.Mirror
member.summary: Times exceeding the endpoint will reverse direction and sample backwards.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.DeactivationManagement.DeactivationManager.VelocityLowerLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the velocity under which the deactivation system will consider objects to be deactivation candidates (if their velocity stays below the limit for the LowVelocityTimeMinimum). Defaults to 0.26.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.DeactivationManagement.DeactivationManager.LowVelocityTimeMinimum
member.summary: Gets or sets the time limit above which the deactivation system will consider objects to be deactivation candidates (if their velocity stays below the VelocityLowerLimit for the duration). Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.DeactivationManagement.DeactivationManager.UseStabilization
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not to use a stabilization effect on nearly motionless objects. This removes a lot of energy from a system when things are settling down, allowing them to go to sleep faster. It also makes most simulations appear a lot more robust. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.DeactivationManagement.DeactivationManager.MaximumDeactivationsPerFrame
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of objects to attempt to deactivate each frame. Defaults to 100.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.DeactivationManagement.DeactivationManager.TimeStepSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets the time step settings used by the deactivation manager.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.DeactivationManagement.DeactivationManager.SimulationIslands
member.summary: Gets the simulation islands currently in the manager.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.DeactivationManagement.DeactivationManager.MaximumSplitAttemptsFraction
member.summary: Gets or sets the fraction of splits that the deactivation manager will attempt in a single frame. The total splits queued multiplied by this value results in the number of splits managed. Defaults to .04f.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.DeactivationManagement.DeactivationManager.MinimumSplitAttempts
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum number of splits attempted in a single frame. Defaults to 5.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Joints.SwivelHingeAngularJoint
member.summary: Constrains two bodies so that they can rotate relative to each other like a modified door hinge. Instead of removing two degrees of freedom, only one is removed so that the second connection to the constraint can twist.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Joints.SwivelHingeAngularJoint.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new constraint which allows relative angular motion around a hinge axis and a twist axis. To finish the initialization, specify the connections (ConnectionA and ConnectionB) as well as the WorldHingeAxis and WorldTwistAxis (or their entity-local versions). This constructor sets the constraint's IsActive property to false by default.

member.summary: Constructs a new constraint which allows relative angular motion around a hinge axis and a twist axis.
member.param: Hinge axis attached to connectionA. The connected entities will be able to rotate around this axis relative to each other.
Twist axis attached to connectionB. The connected entities will be able to rotate around this axis relative to each other.
